content.question: Let <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the triangular region in the first quadrant with vertices at points <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="coordinates h comma 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="coordinates h comma lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are positive constants. Which of the following gives the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to lowercase r, of, open parenthesis, the fraction h over lowercase r, end fraction, times x, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to h, of, open parenthesis, the fraction h over lowercase r, end fraction, times x, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to lowercase r, of, open parenthesis, the fraction lowercase r over h, end fraction, times x, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to h, of, open parenthesis, the fraction lowercase r over h, end fraction, times x, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to h, of, open parenthesis, the fraction lowercase r over h, end fraction, times x, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.9: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around the x- or y-Axis
